name: Rechercher des entreprises sur LinkedIn, évaluer avec l'IA et les ajouter à Google Sheet CRM
description:
# Rechercher des entreprises sur LinkedIn, évaluer avec l'IA et les ajouter à Google Sheet CRM

**Vidéo de configuration : [https://youtube.com/watch?v=m904RNxtF0w&t](https://youtube.com/watch?v=m904RNxtF0w&t)**

### Pour qui est-ce ?
Ce modèle est idéal pour les équipes de vente, les professionnels du développement commercial et les marketeurs cherchant à construire une base de données de prospects ciblés avec qualification automatique. Parfait pour les agences, les consultants et les entreprises B2B souhaitant identifier et prioriser les clients potentiels les plus prometteurs.

### Quel problème ce flux de travail résout-il ?
La recherche manuelle d'entreprises sur LinkedIn, l'évaluation de leur adéquation à vos services et leur suivi dans votre CRM est chronophage et subjective. Cette automatisation rationalise la génération de leads en trouvant, évaluant et important automatiquement des prospects qualifiés dans votre base de données.

### Ce que fait ce flux de travail
Ce flux de travail recherche automatiquement des entreprises sur LinkedIn en fonction de vos critères, récupère des informations détaillées sur chaque entreprise, les filtre en fonction des indicateurs de qualité, utilise l'IA pour évaluer à quel point elles correspondent à votre profil client idéal, et les ajoute à votre Google Sheet CRM tout en évitant les doublons.

### Configuration
1. Créez un compte API Ghost Genius et obtenez votre clé API
2. Configurez les nœuds de requête HTTP avec les identifiants d'authentification par en-tête
3. Créez une copie du modèle Google Sheet fourni
4. Configurez votre Google Sheet et vos identifiants OpenAI en suivant la documentation n8n
5. Personnalisez le nœud "Définir les variables" pour correspondre à votre public cible et à vos critères de notation

### Comment personnaliser ce flux de travail
- Modifiez les paramètres de recherche pour cibler différentes industries, emplacements ou tailles d'entreprise
- Ajustez le seuil du nombre de followers en fonction de vos critères de qualification
- Personnalisez le système de notation IA pour l'aligner avec votre produit ou service spécifique
- Ajoutez des nœuds de notification pour vous alerter lorsque des entreprises à haute note sont identifiées

assignments.name: B: 1-10 employees, C: 11-50 employees, D: 51-200 employees, E: 201-500 employees, F: 501-1000 employees, G: 1001-5000 employees, H: 5001-10,000 employees, I: 10,001+ employees
Positive indicators (3-5 specific factors that indicate a company might need your product)
assignments.value:
- Mentions challenges with customer relationships or sales processes 
- Company is in growth phase with expanding client base 
- Mentions need for better data organization or customer insights 
- References marketing automation, sales pipelines, or customer retention

assignments.name: Negative indicators (3-5 specific factors that indicate a company might NOT need your product)
assignments.value:
- Very small companies (1-5 employees) or extremely large enterprises 
- Already mentions using advanced CRM solutions 
- No indication of sales process or customer relationship management in description 
- Pure manufacturing or product-based business with minimal customer interaction 
- Non-profit or government entity with unique relationship management needs

parameters.name: company_size
parameters.value: ={{ $json['B: 1-10 employees, C: 11-50 employees, D: 51-200 employees, E: 201-500 employees, F: 501-1000 employees, G: 1001-5000 employees, H: 5001-10,000 employees, I: 10,001+ employees'] }}

values.content:
=You are an AI assistant that evaluates companies to determine if they might be interested in {{ $('Set Variables').item.json['Your product or service'] }}.

Evaluate the company information provided on a scale of 0 to 10, where:
- 0 = Not at all likely to be interested
- 10 = Extremely likely to be interested

Base your evaluation on these criteria:
1. Industry fit: How well does the company's industry align with {{ $('Set Variables').item.json['Your product or service'] }}?
2. Company profile: Is the company size, growth stage, and location appropriate for {{ $('Set Variables').item.json['Your product or service'] }}?
3. Pain points: Based on their description, do they likely have challenges that {{ $('Set Variables').item.json['Your product or service'] }} solves?

Factors that indicate a good fit:
{{ $('Set Variables').item.json['Positive indicators (3-5 specific factors that indicate a company might need your product)'] }}

Factors that indicate a poor fit:
{{ $('Set Variables').item.json['Negative indicators (3-5 specific factors that indicate a company might NOT need your product)'] }}

Respond ONLY with this JSON format:
```json
{
  "score": [number between 0 and 10],
}

parameters.content:
## LinkedIn Company Search
This section initiates the workflow and searches for your target companies on LinkedIn using the Ghost Genius API.

You can filter and refine your search using keywords, company size, location, industry, or even whether the company has active job postings. Use the "Set Variables" node for it (this node also allows you to customize the AI Lead Scoring prompt).

Note that you can retrieve a maximum of 1000 companies per search (corresponding to 100 LinkedIn pages), so it's important not to exceed this number of results to avoid losing prospects.

Example: Let's say I want to target Growth Marketing Agencies with 11-50 employees. I do my search and see that there are 10,000 results. So I refine my search by using location to go country by country and retrieve all 10,000 results in several batches ranging from 500 to 1000 depending on the country.

Tips: To test the workflow or to see the number of results of your search, change the pagination parameter (Max Pages) in the "Search Companies" node. It will be displayed at the very top of the response JSON.

## Company Data Processing 
This section processes each company individually.

We retrieve all the company information using Get Company Details by using the LinkedIn link obtained from the previous section.

Then we filter the company based on the number of followers, which gives us a first indication of the company's credibility (200 in this case), and whether their LinkedIn page has a website listed.

The workflow implements batch processing with a 2-second delay between requests to respect API rate limits. This methodical approach ensures reliable data collection while preventing API timeouts.

You can adjust these thresholds based on your target market - increasing the follower count for more established businesses or decreasing it for emerging markets.

The last two modules checks if the company already exists in your database (using LinkedIn ID) to prevent duplicates because when you do close enough searches, some companies may come up several times.

## AI Scoring and Storage
This section scores the company and stores it in a Google Sheet.

It's important to properly fill in the "Set variables" node at the beginning of the workflow to get a result relevant to your use case. You can also manually modify the system prompt.

Regardless of the score obtained, it's very important to always store the company. Note that we add a 2-second "wait" module to respect Google Sheet's rate limits.

We add the company to the "Companies" sheet in this [Google Sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LfhqpyjimLjyQcmWY8mUr6YtNBcifiOVLIhAJGV9jiM/edit?usp=sharing) which you can make a copy of and use.

This AI scoring functionality is extremely impressive once perfectly configured, so I recommend taking some time to test with several companies to ensure the scoring system works well for your needs!

## Introduction
Welcome to my template! Before explaining how to set it up, here's some important information:

This automation is an alternative version of [this template](https://n8n.io/workflows/3717-search-linkedin-companies-and-add-them-to-airtable-crm/) that differs by using Google Sheets instead of Airtable and adding a Lead Scoring system allowing for more precision in our targeting.

This automation therefore allows you, starting from a LinkedIn search, to enrich company data and score them to determine if they might be interested in your services/product.

For any questions, you can send me a DM on my [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/matthieu-belin83/) :)

## Setup
- Create an account on [Ghost Genius API](ghostgenius.fr) and get your API key.

- Configure the Search Companies and Get Company Info modules by creating a "Header Auth" credential:
**Name: "Authorization"**
**Value: "Bearer api_key"**

- Create a copy of this [Google Sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LfhqpyjimLjyQcmWY8mUr6YtNBcifiOVLIhAJGV9jiM/edit?usp=sharing) by clicking on File => Make a copy (in Google Sheet).

- Configure your Google Sheet credential by following the n8n documentation.

- Create an OpenAI key [here](https://platform.openai.com/docs/overview) and add the credential to the "AI Company Scoring" node following the n8n documentation.

- Add your information to the "Set Variables" node.

## Tools 
**(You can use the API and CRM of your choice; this is only a suggestion)**

- API Linkedin : [Ghost Genius API](https://ghostgenius.fr) 

- API Documentation : [Documentation](https://ghostgenius.fr/docs)

- CRM : [Google Sheet](https://workspace.google.com/intl/en/products/sheets/)

- AI : [OpenAI](https://openai.com)

- LinkedIn Location ID Finder : [Ghost Genius Locations ID Finder](https://ghostgenius.fr/tools/search-sales-navigator-locations-id)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
